bug.short_desc: lots of warnings while compiling on RedHat Linux

long_desc.thetext:
Same on Solaris - presumably any OS.
The fix I used was to add
struct et_list;
before the prototypes that use it, but I suppose the struct definitions could be moved into the .h files.

This warning is coming from files generated by compile_et. The version that ships with Cyrus in et/ don't cause this problem, so it looks like the version(s) that ships with various OSs are causing this. Specifically, et_[ch].awk on my FC4 system seem to be the culprit.

The bug in the RH supplied compile_et has presumably been fixed a long time ago, as we've been doing a twice-daily build on a CentOS (RHEL-based) machine for two years now with no problems. So RESOLVEing this bug.
